title: Snoop Dogg Covers Nick Cave for Peaky Blinders : Listen
text:
Snoop Dogg has shared a cover of Nick Cave & the Bad Seeds’ “Red Right Hand.” The song off 1994’s Let Love In serves as the theme song for the BBC One show Peaky Blinders. “By the order of the Peaky Blinders, this is ‘Red Right Hand’ by Snoop Shelby,” Snoop says before donning a flat cap like the one worn by the show’s British gangsters. Listen to the cover below.

Snoop is not the first artist to cover Cave’s song for the show: PJ Harvey, Arctic Monkeys, Laura Marling, FIDLAR, and Iggy Pop and Jarvis Cocker have each given the track a new twist.

Originally Appeared on Pitchfork
description: He does Cave & The Bad Seeds’ “Red Right Hand,” which is also the BBC One show’s theme song
